mop.translation[0].definitions[0].defini: a thing used for washing floors, consisting of a long stick with threads of thick string or a piece of sponge fastened to one end
mop.translation[0].definitions[1].defini: a thing used for cleaning dishes, consisting of a short stick with a piece of sponge fastened to one end
mop.translation[0].definitions[2].defini: a large amount of thick, often untidy hair
mop.translation[0].definitions[2].exampl: He ran a hand through his mop of fair hair.
mop.translation[1].definitions[0].defini: to wash a floor with a wet mop
mop.translation[1].definitions[0].exampl: She carried on mopping the floor.
mop.translation[1].definitions[1].defini: to dry your face by rubbing it with a cloth or something soft
mop.translation[1].definitions[1].exampl: It was so hot he had to keep stopping to mop his face.
The doctor mopped his brow  (=removed sweat from his forehead) with a handkerchief.
mop.translation[1].definitions[2].defini: to remove liquid from a surface by rubbing it with a cloth or something soft
mop.translation[1].definitions[2].exampl: She gently mopped the blood from the wound.
He mopped the sweat from his face.
She mopped the tears away with a lacy handkerchief.
